body.p:
To His Excellency
James F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky

We certify that William White who was recently convicted in the Jefferson Circuit Court for Malicious Stabbing was in our employ at the Louisville Paper Mill for Fifteen Years, and during all that time he was strictly attentive to his duties, peaceable, quiet, and orderly; in a word he is a man of Exemplary Character.
We earnestly beg your Excellency to exercise your constitutional perogative & grant a pardon to William White
We the undersigned Citizens of Louisville Kentucky do earnestly unite in the prayer for a pardon for Wm White

T. C. Coleman
B. J. Spalding
I prosecuted J William White the petitioner in the city Court of Louisville & I believe that Executive Clemency will have been worthily & justly & bestowed in the pardon of his pardon.

Jefferson Cir. Ct
Wm White
17. Months in Penty
"Malicious Stabbing"
Pardon Issd
May 12. 1863
